Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 10:24AM kajo119 wrote: Hi all, I had a lumpectomy on Dec. 7. I'm suppose to start rad treatments 1/29. But I'm concerned about my breast being swollen and red around the nipple. The rad dr. put me on antibotics last week, concerned about mastitis, but it hasn't helped yet. I want to go through this with others too. We can all help each other. I'm all for the February Rad Team.!
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2008 05:33PM kajo119 wrote: Hi ladies, I will be finished maybe the 19th with rads, keep having minor setbacks, went to my pcp and told him I had been having night sweats and hot flashes, he gave me Clonidine HCI, which is used for high blood pressure usually, but which I don't have, thankfully, anyway, he said it would make the flashes stop. I have taken 2 so far, and I have to say I have not flashed today, I am sleepy but not sweating. So if anyone is having those covers on, covers off, all night long, ask about this. It just may be the thang. Where can you find the aleo gel w/o alcohol? Ive checked walmart and cvs. no luck. This is the only place that understands what we go thru.
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2008 10:21AM kajo119 wrote: Does anyone get energy for about a day and then have none for it seems days and days?  And yes my shoulder hurts some, mentioned that to dr. to make sure that was normal, tightness is normal, mentioned discomfort when I breathed, he said that wasn't normal, but nothing else. Maybe I need a chiropractic adjustment.  I am red and itchy, using the aquaphor and aloe. Got a prescription for the itching, said to use it about once a week? because it will thin the skin. ok.  I am getting those prickly spots that hurt now when touched. Sorry this is so down, geez!
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl
Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2008 03:10PM kajo119 wrote: Artsee, My score was a 23, the doctor said was in the middle, so she got some other data for us to compare and we decided together that the 2% benefit from chemo was not worth going thru the chemo treatments. I have to say that sometimes I wonder if I made the right decision, sometimes I feel that a cancer cell is lurking somewhere else in my body and I should have had the chemo. But the odds are very much favorable that that is not the case.  I would suggest, if you haven't already, go to a Breast cancer support group, I went Monday and found it very comforting and informative. Gentle Hugs & Prayers to you
